org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple

Class SimpleRiverSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple.SimpleRiverSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RiverSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColumnRiverSource

    public class SimpleRiverSource
extends Object
implements RiverSource
    Simple river source.

    The simple river source iterates through a JDBC result set, merges the rows into Elasticsearch documents, and passes them to a bulk indexer.

    There are two channels open, one for reading the database, one for writing.

      • beforeRows

        public void beforeRows(SQLCommand command,
              ResultSet results,
              KeyValueStreamListener listener)
                throws SQLException,
                       IOException
        Before rows are read, let the KeyValueStreamListener know about the keys. If the SQL command was a callable statement and a register is there, look into the register map for the key names, not in the result set metadata.
        Specified by:
        beforeRows in interface RiverSource
        Parameters:
        command - the SQL command that created this result set
        results - the result set
        listener - the key/value stream listener
        Throws:
        SQLException - when SQL execution gives an error
        IOException - when input/output error occurs

      • nextRow

        public boolean nextRow(SQLCommand command,
              ResultSet results,
              KeyValueStreamListener listener)
                throws SQLException,
                       IOException
        Get next row and prepare the values for processing. The labels of each columns are used for the ValueListener as paths for JSON object merging.
        Specified by:
        nextRow in interface RiverSource
        Parameters:
        command - the SQL command that created this result set
        results - the result set
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        true if row exists and was processed, false otherwise
        Throws:
        SQLException - when SQL execution gives an error
        IOException - when input/output error occurs
